title: (x) Disco 76 - Optex {Yves}
content:
Hi i have a big problem in finding the name for this font.   
Can you help me? ![unknownfontnamedisco76](http://web.archive.org/web/20150420023700im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/32227.png)
author: ingo

comments.content:
Yes Yves, looks like a logo made from Optex. Mike Yanega has the Letraset Sample in his [Lined Font Identification Guide](http://web.archive.org/web/20150420023700/http:/www.bowfinprintworks.com/LinedFontGuide05.html).   
I believe it's not digitized ...

Ok i found the original name for the font: optex letraset 1970   
   
And here comes my next question:   
   
Where can I download the font?/where is it included?   
   
or : where is it buyable?
Looks like Optex, but couldn't find a digital equivalent.

[Odessa](http://web.archive.org/web/20150420023700/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/itc/odessa/) (based on Futura) and [Zeppelin](http://web.archive.org/web/20150420023700/http:/www.philsfonts.com/detail.html?sku=AG61707801P1) (based on Kabel) are similar but no matches.
I don't think it's been digitized. Well not that I know of...
In 2010, The Northern Block released a digital version called [Olympik](http://web.archive.org/web/20150420023700/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/northernblock/olympik/?refby=typographica).
